channel.title: Wildlife Disease Information Node News Digest - GeoRSS Feed
channel.description: Last 45 days of georeferenced entries on the wdin.blogspot.com blog

item.title: Deer Affected by Disease (Oregon, United States)
item.description: Published by News/Talk 1110 KBND - www.kbnd.com on 12/9/2010 - Oregon Department of Fish and Wildlife officials say they have found more deer dead from adenovirus hemorrhagic disease than in the past.

item.title: Yellow fever - South America: Venezuela (AN) monkey, susp - Archive Number 20101112.4114 (Anzoategui, Venezuela)
item.description: Published by ProMED Mail - www.promedmail.org on 11/12/2010 - In Anzoategui state, 3 probable yellow fever cases were detected [in monkeys]. This outbreak would be enzootic, as determined by the Ministry of Health.

item.title: Crayfish plague - Italy: (VN) OIE (Veneto, Italy)
item.description: Published by ProMED Mail - www.promedmail.org on 11/26/2010 - Crayfish plague (_Aphanomyces astaci_), Italy Information received on (and dated) 26 Nov 2010 from Prof Dr Romano Marabelli, chief veterinary officer, Department for Veterinary Public Health, Nutrition and Food Safety, Ministry of Health, Rome, Italy

item.title: Rabies - Ukraine (02): (ZT) fox, human exposure (Zhitomir, Ukraine)
item.description: Published by ProMED Mail - www.promedmail.org on 11/12/2010 - ... Officials of the Ministry have stated that rabid foxes, which are unusually abundant this year [2010], are the source of the human infections.

item.title: Bird AIDS virus splits rare parrot saviours (Tasmania, Australia)
item.description: Published by The Birds Nest - www.thebirdsnest.net.au on 10/17/2010 - Dr Raidal heads a laboratory where testing for PCD can be carried out, and says the captive Orange Bellied parrot population in Tasmania is definitely infected with the disease.

item.title: Probable outbreak among raccoons (Clatsop, Oregon, United States)
item.description: Published by NECN.com - www.necn.com on 12/19/2010 - State wildlife officials are investigating a probable outbreak of canine distemper among raccoons along the north coast from Seaside to Astoria.

item.title: Efforts fail to halt pneumonia outbreak in sheep (Deer Lodge, Montana, United States)
item.description: Published by Billings Gazette - www.billingsgazette.net on 11/9/2010 - Wildlife officials will let a pneumonia outbreak run its course through a herd of bighorn sheep west of Anaconda after killing dozens of sick animals failed to keep the disease in check.

item.title: 2nd ND deer tests positive for chronic wasting (Grant, North Dakota, United States)
item.description: Published by Daily Republic - www.mitchellrepublic.com on 12/13/2010 - A second mule deer killed in south central North Dakota has tested positive for chronic wasting disease.

item.title: CWD find raises threat up north (Bayfield, Wisconsin, United States)
item.description: Published by Superior Telegram - www.superiortelegram.com on 11/15/2010 - A white-tailed deer from a shooting preserve in northern Wisconsin has tested positive on a screening test for chronic wasting disease -- a discovery that has the potential to bring the disease to a new part of the state.

item.title: Rabid bats on the rise in Los Angeles County (Los Angeles, California, United States)
item.description: Published by Reuters - www.reuters.com on 11/18/2010 - ... According to the Department of Public Health, 21 bats with rabies have been found in Los Angeles County this year, more than double the average number of 10.

item.title: Feds investigate latest Mexican wolf death (Catron, New Mexico, United States)
item.description: Published by KSWT 13 News - www.kswt.com on 12/10/2010 - Federal law enforcement officials are investigating the shooting death of a Mexican gray wolf in southwestern New Mexico.

item.title: Dead coyote tests positive for rabies (St. Clair, Alabama, United States)
item.description: Published by The St. Clair Times - www.thestclairtimes.com on 11/19/2010 - St. Clair County Rabies Officer Dr. Larry Chasteen is continuing efforts to locate the origin of a rabid coyote left at his Pell City office last week.

item.title: Vehicle hits, kills Florida panther in S.W. Fla. (Hendry, Florida, United States)
item.description: Published by Miami Herald - www.miamiherald.com on 12/20/2010 - A young Florida panther was struck and killed along a Hendry County roadway.

item.title: S. Korea confirms bird flu outbreak in southern province (Iksan, Cholla-bukto, South Korea)
item.description: Published by Yonhap News - english.yonhapnews.co.kr on 12/8/2010 - The South Korean government confirmed on Tuesday a bird flu outbreak in a southwestern region of the country, a main winter habitat of migratory birds.... The ministry conducted an emergency disinfection of the area around the Mangyeong River, where the infected wild bird was found, and put an area within a 10-kilometer radius from the site of the outbreak under intensive care.

item.title: Stranded Dolphin Transferred to Galveston (Padre Island National Seashore, Kenedy Texas, United States)
item.description: Published by KZTV 10 News - www.kztv10.com on 12/13/2010 - A bottle nose dolphin found stranded at the Padre Island National Seashore is in critical condition at a rehabilitation center in Galveston. Buc-ee, a 7-year old male, was found stranded on Friday evening.

item.title: Whales found dead on Donegal beach (County Donegal, Northern Ireland, United Kingdom)
item.description: Published by BBC News - news.bbc.co.uk on 11/7/2010 - Scientists have taken skin and tissue samples from the 33 pilot whales which died off the coast of County Donegal.

item.title: Shot koala battles on (Kenilworth, Queensland, Australia)
item.description: Published by Herald Sun - www.heraldsun.com.au on 11/9/2010 - A BABY koala continues to fight for life after a second round of surgery to remove gunshot pellets from her body.

item.title: Moorcroft deer had CWD (Moorcroft, Crook Wyoming, United States)
item.description: Published by Little Chicago Review - www.littlechicagoreview.com on 11/10/2010 - A white-tailed buck harvested Nov. 1 in hunt area 3 about three miles northwest of Moorcroft has tested positive for chronic wasting disease (CWD), a brain disease known to affect some deer, elk and moose.

item.title: Fungus Caused St. Johns River fish kill (Orange Park, Clay Florida, United States)
item.description: Published by Clay Today - www.claytoday.biz/index.php on 11/15/2010 - Biologists with the Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission?s (FWC) Fish and Wildlife Research Institute have determined the cause of a recent fish kill in the St. Johns River. Testing confirmed that a fungus led to the fish die-off that occurred in the river in mid-October.

item.title: Avian influenza (52): world update, FAO (Lake Onuma, Hokkaido, Japan)
item.description: Published by ProMED Mail - www.promedmail.org on 11/18/2010 - The Ministry of Environment announced that an H5N1 AI virus was found through the surveillance of wild duck dropping conducted by the Hokkaido University.... There is no death of wild birds found in the Onuma area.

item.title: Rabies confirmed in coyote in Cortez (Cortez, Montezuma Colorado, United States)
item.description: Published by KWGN Denver Channel 2 News - www.kwgn.com on 11/23/2010 - A coyote in Cortez has tested positive for rabies according to lab results from the Colorado Department of Public Health and Environment.

item.title: Whale carcass removed from CT beach (Sea Point, Western Cape, South Africa)
item.description: Published by Eyewitness News - www.eyewitnessnews.co.za on 11/24/2010 - City of Cape Town authorities were hard at work on Wednesday afternoon trying to remove a decomposing whale carcass in Sea Point.... It is not yet clear how the mammal died.

item.title: Avian diphtheria hits yellow-eyed penguins (Otago Peninsula, Otago, New Zealand)
item.description: Published by Otago Daily Times - www.odt.co.nz on 11/24/2010 - An outbreak of avian diphtheria has hit southern Otago Peninsula yellow-eyed penguins.

item.title: Swan death caused by yobs? (Leeds and Liverpool Canal, England, United Kingdom)
item.description: Published by Wigan Today - www.wigantoday.net on 11/24/2010 - Could vicious yobs have killed another of Wigan's precious swans? That was the question being asked this week after the body of a bird was found floating on the murky waters of the Leeds and Liverpool Canal at the back of the DW Stadium.

item.title: Cautious of an outbreak (Tillsonburg, Ontario, Canada)
item.description: Published by Tillsonburg News on 11/24/2010 - Reports of raccoons "acting funny" have a local wildlife custodian worried there may be an outbreak of a deadly animal disease in Tillsonburg.

item.title: CWD found in city harvested deer (Buffalo, Johnson Wyoming, United States)
item.description: Published by Buffalo Bulletin - www.buffalobulletin.com on 11/23/2010 - In an unexpected turn with the city of Buffalo’s deer management program, two of the deer harvested within city limits last week tested positive for Chronic Wasting Disease.

item.title: More Pelicans Wash Up On Beaches (North Topsail Beach, Onslow North Carolina, United States)
item.description: Published by WCTI Channel 12 News - www.wcti12.com on 12/18/2010 - Another day, another group of pelicans are found dead on local beaches. A wildlife volunteer made a gruesome find Friday night.

item.title: Reward increased for information on dead pelicans (North Topsail Beach, Onslow North Carolina, United States)
item.description: Published by Jacksonville Daily News - www.jdnews.com on 12/3/2010 - ... To date more than 40 dead pelicans have been reported, and there are still no suspects.

item.title: Pelican mystery baffles NC officials (North Topsail Beach, Onslow North Carolina, United States)
item.description: Published by WAVY TV 10 - www.wavy.com on 11/22/2010 - Officials in North Topsail Beach are looking into the intentional killing of at least 25 pelicans.

item.title: Coral reefs found damaged (Phi Phi Islands, Krabi, Thailand)
item.description: Published by Bangkok Post - www.bangkokpost.com on 11/30/2010 - Up to 90% of coral reefs off the Phi Phi islands has been damaged by bleaching and human activities, a study has found.

item.title: Public warned to stay away from sick foxes in Wheat Ridge (Wheat Ridge, Jefferson Colorado, United States)
item.description: Published by Denver Post - www.denverpost.com on 12/2/2010 - Wheat Ridge residents are being warned to stay away from foxes because of an outbreak of mange, which can be transmitted to humans.

item.title: Lufkin skunk tests positive for rabies (Lufkin, Angelina Texas, United States)
item.description: Published by KTRE-TV - www.ktre.com on 12/3/2010 - City of Lufkin Animal Control personnel have confirmed that a skunk found deceased in a Lufkin neighborhood was infected with rabies... "this is the first Angelina County skunk to test positive for rabies since 2003, when we had fourteen rabies-positive skunk cases."

item.title: Department of Wildlife: Investigators rule out bird flu, West Nile, avian botulism in pelican deaths near Reno (Washoe Lake, Washoe Nevada, United States)
item.description: Published by Reno Gazette-Journal - www.rgj.com on 12/3/2010 - Investigators still are not clear what killed the 22 pelicans found dead in early October at Washoe Lake, south of Reno, the Nevada Department of Wildlife reported.

item.title: Fur seal cubs clubbed to death in New Zealand (Ohau Point, Southland, New Zealand)
item.description: Published by Guardian Unlimited - www.guardian.co.uk on 12/6/2010 - Twenty-three fur seals, including eight pups, have been clubbed to death at a New Zealand breeding colony that was re-established two decades ago after the species was nearly wiped out by hunting. Some of the pups were just days old.

item.title: Wayward Sea Lion Euthanized At Marine Mammal Center (Oakley, Contra Costa California, United States)
item.description: Published by KTVU News - www.ktvu.com on 12/7/2010 - A disoriented sea lion found wandering the streets of unincorporated Contra Costa County near Oakley on Saturday was euthanized Tuesday morning after the animal was found to have brain damage from toxic algae exposure, a Marine Mammal Center spokesman said.

item.title: Sea lion Na'au roams Oakley (Oakley, Contra Costa California, United States)
item.description: Published by San Francisco Chronicle - www.sfgate.com on 12/6/2010 - A long-suffering sea lion with a history of meandering away from the sea was nabbed again this weekend after she was found strolling the streets of Oakley, about a mile from the nearest source of water.

item.title: Raccoon tests positive - but park critics are rabid (Prospect Park, Kings New York, United States)
item.description: Published by Brooklyn Paper - www.brooklynpaper.com on 12/8/2010 - A Prospect Park raccoon has tested positive for rabies - and park advocates are slamming city and park officials for being part of the problem.

item.title: Sea lion shot in the head remains in critical but stable condition (Sausalito, Marin California, United States)
item.description: Published by San Francisco Examiner - www.sfexaminer.com on 12/10/2010 - A California sea lion remains in critical but stable condition at Sausalito's Marine Mammal Center on Friday after being found on a beach with a gunshot wound to his head, a spokesman for the center said.

item.title: Find Cody deer with CWD; Big Horn Basin now has 13 hunt areas confirmed positive (Bighorn Basin, Big Horn Wyoming, United States)
item.description: Published by Little Chicago Review - www.littlechicagoreview.com on 12/9/2010 - Chronic wasting disease (CWD), a fatal neurological disease of deer, elk and moose, has been discovered in deer hunt area 119, bringing the known total of CWD hunt areas in the Big Horn Basin to thirteen; four new hunt areas (areas 47, 51, 119, 124) were confirmed positive this fall in the basin.

item.title: Avian influenza (62): South Korea (GN) H5N1, wild bird, RFI (Seosan, Chungchong-namdo, South Korea)
item.description: Published by ProMED Mail - www.promedmail.org on 12/12/2010 - South Korean quarantine officials found two dead eagle owls infected with the virulent strain of bird flu in the central western part of the country on Friday [10 Dec 2010].

item.title: Sperm Whale Beaches Itself At Torrey Pines State Beach (Torrey Pines State Beach, San Diego California, United States)
item.description: Published by KGTV 10 News - www.10news.com on 12/13/2010 - A baby sperm whale kept rescuers from SeaWorld busy into the early morning hours Monday after it came ashore at Torrey Pines State Beach, a video photographer said.... The photographer said the veterinarian told him the baby whale beached itself because of being lost or being sick.

item.title: LNG construction kills wildlife (Curtis Island, Queensland, Australia)
item.description: Published by Gladstone Observer - www.gladstoneobserver.com.au on 12/15/2010 - ANIMALS have been killed or injured as a result of liquefied natural gas (LNG) construction on Curtis Island.

item.title: 18 canine distemper cases reported in Troy in past 20 days (Troy, Rensselaer New York, United States)
item.description: Published by CBS 6 WRGB - www.cbs6albany.com on 12/17/2010 - Animal control says it's handled 18 cases of canine distemper in the city's fox population over the last 20 days, posing a possible threat to domestic animals.

item.title: Poisoning drives vulture decline in Masai Mara, Kenya (Masai Mara Game Reserve, Rift Valley, Kenya)
item.description: Published by BBC News - news.bbc.co.uk on 12/17/2010 - Vulture populations in one of Africa's most important wildlife reserves have declined by 60%, say scientists. The researchers suggest that the decline of vultures in Kenya's Masai Mara is being driven by poisoning.

item.title: Tottori avian flu hunt finds 23 dead birds (Yonago, Tottori Prefecture, Chugoku, Japan)
item.description: Published by Japan Times Online - search.japantimes.co.jp on 12/20/2010 - Tottori Prefectural Government experts found 23 dead birds Sunday in the city of Yonago during field studies conducted to look for abnormalities after a strain of the highly pathogenic avian flu virus was found in a dead swan.

item.title: Tottori avian flu hunt finds 23 dead birds (Takaoka, Toyama Prefecture, Chubu, Japan)
item.description: Published by Japan Times Online - search.japantimes.co.jp on 12/20/2010 - Tottori Prefectural Government experts found 23 dead birds Sunday in the city of Yonago during field studies conducted to look for abnormalities after a strain of the highly pathogenic avian flu virus was found in a dead swan.

item.title: Bryde's whale beaching a mystery (Iluka, Western Australia, Australia)
item.description: Published by Daily Examiner - www.dailyexaminer.com.au on 12/21/2010 - THE National Parks and Wildlife Service (NPWS) is uncertain as to what caused a 10.6-metre Bryde’s whale to beach itself on 10 Mile Beach, north of Iluka, late last week.

item.title: Conservationists highlight worsening plight of UK crayfish (United Kingdom)
item.description: Published by Bristol Zoo Gardens - www.bristolzoo.org.uk on 11/9/2010 - Bristol conservationists are highlighting the worsening plight of native crayfish as the species is officially upgraded to ‘endangered’. White-clawed crayfish are the UK’s only native freshwater crayfish, but their numbers have suffered extensive decline in recent years. Experts warn the species could become extinct from the UK within the next 30 years; it is currently a protected species.

item.title: Mystery virus threatens an already critically endangered Australian parrot species (Australia)
item.description: Published by Scientific American - www.scientificamerican.com on 11/11/2010 - The orange-bellied parrot (Neophema chrysogaster), one of the world's most critically endangered birds, could lose its bid at survival as a virus threatens its vitally important captive breeding program.

item.title: Virus threatens rare parrot (Australia)
item.description: Published by United Press International - www.upi.com on 11/7/2010 - A virus is threatening the critically endangered orange-bellied parrot in Australia. The common stomach virus found in many Australian birds is striking the orange-bellied parrot at a breeding program for the bird. The virus causes the birds' immune system to break down.
